required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating a Two Stage Intrapartum Fetal Assessment in India
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Impact of Introducing a Two Stage Intrapartum Fetal Monitoring Assessment Using Intermittent Auscultation and Cardiotocography in a Government Hospital, Nagpur, India

brief_summary.textblock: An intrapartum fetal monitoring training programme (on intermittent auscultation and cardiotocography) will be delivered at Government Medical College (GMC) to all relevant staff. This quality improvement project and training evaluation aims to assess and evaluate the impact of this training. This will allow the investigators to understand if it is feasible and acceptable to staff, increases knowledge and improves patient outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
As part of Misoprostol or Oxytocin for Labour Induction (MOLI) randomised controlled trial (RCT) (CTRI no. NCT03749902), Government Medical College (GMC) plans to increase the number of cardiotocography (CTG) machines available on labour ward and provide a United Kingdom (UK) based obstetrician to deliver training on cardiotocography (CTG) interpretation in order to improve fetal monitoring for this high risk population.
An intrapartum fetal monitoring training programme (on intermittent auscultation and cardiotocography) will be delivered at Government Medical College (GMC) to all relevant staff. This quality improvement project and training evaluation aims to assess and evaluate the impact of this training. This will allow the investigators to understand if it is feasible and acceptable to staff, increases knowledge and improves patient outcomes. It will be done through staff questionnaires, pre-and-post test scores and by examining the effects on maternal and perinatal outcomes using Kirkpatrick's training evaluation.
The whole project aims:
- To understand current practice and maternal and perinatal outcomes in Government Medical College (GMC)
- To improve intrapartum fetal monitoring with intermittent auscultation and cardiotocography (CTG)
- To improve perinatal morbidity and mortality rates
- To reduce caesarean section rates for presumed fetal compromise

primary_outcome.measure: Caesarean section performed for presumed fetal compromise as a prortion of all caesarean sections
primary_outcome.description: Percentage change of rate per month

secondary_outcome.description: Average number of times fetal heart rate (FHR) documented per mother • Number of times fetal heart rate (FHR) documented in labour

secondary_outcome.measure: Intrapartum fetal monitoring - Improved documentation of fetal heart rate
secondary_outcome.description: Average time between last FHR documented and delivery (minutes) • Average time between last fetal heart rate (FHR) documented and delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Intrapartum fetal monitoring - Improved documentation (Risk factors for poor perinatal outcome)
secondary_outcome.description: Average number of fetal risk factors documented per mother • Risk factors for poor perinatal outcome
Average number of cases discussed per meeting • Number of cases (CTGs and poor perinatal outcomes) discussed
Number of staff trained as a percentage of the number of eligible staff. Senior doctors Residents Nurses/midwives Students

secondary_outcome.measure: Training - Improvement in pre and post test scores
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage change between pre and post test scores, per staff member trained

secondary_outcome.measure: Training - Improvement in self perceived knowledge and confidence about intrapartum fetal monitoring
Training - satisfaction and feedback about training
secondary_outcome.description: Survey data from staff attending training. Semi-structured questions.
Number of cases of caesarean section/month as a % of all births
Number of cases of operative delivery/month as a % of all births

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal - Maternal length of hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: Average length of maternal stay/per patient/month
Number of cases of Apgar score 7 or below at 5 minutes/month as a percentage of all births
Number of cases of cord blood lactate 4.9 mmol/l or above/month as a percentage of all births
Number of babies requiring resuscitation/month as a percentage of all births

secondary_outcome.measure: Perinatal - Neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) admission
secondary_outcome.description: Number of NICU admissions/month as a percentage of all births
Number of cases of birth asphyxia/HIE per month as a percentage of all births
Number of perinatal deaths/month as a percentage of all births

arm_group.description: Maternal and perinatal outcomes will be collected prospectively on all patients that deliver in Government Medical College (GMC) Hospital before, during and after the training over the study period (8 months) in order to evaluate the impact of the training.

intervention.intervention_name: Intrapartum fetal monitoring training and quality improvement project

study_pop.textblock: All women that deliver within the obstetrics department in Government Medical College (GMC) during the study period (8 months)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All women that deliver within the obstetrics department in Government Medical College (GMC) during the study period (8 months)
Exclusion criteria:
- Deliveries in A&E/medical wards
- Home deliveries
- Patients delivered in other hospitals/ambulance deliveries
- Macerated still birth
- Fresh still birth with no fetal heart on admission to hospital

eligibility.gender_description: Women delivered in Government Medical College (GMC) Hospital, Nagpur, India, over two months before, during and two months after project implementation
